question: Question_Section_202_07_(c)
statement:
We want to interpolate through \emph{(0, 1)}, \emph{(1, 0)}, \emph{(2,
2)} using cubic splines

\[f(x) = \begin{cases}
p_1(x), & 0 \leq x \leq 1 \\
p_2(x), & 1 \leq x \leq 2
\end{cases}\]

\textbf{(c)} Interior derivative must be continuous. Write down the
linear equations expressing this condition.
sols:
The only interior point is $(1,0)$. This condition can be written as:

\begin{align*}
p_1'(1) &= p_2'(1)\\
p_2''(1) &= p_2'(1)
\end{align*}

with

$p_1'(x)=3a_1x^2+2b_1x+c_1\Rightarrow p_1'(1)=3a_1+2b_1+c_1$

$p_2'(x)=3a_2(x-1)^2+2b_2(x-1)+c_2\Rightarrow p_2'(1)=0+0+c_2$

and the second derivatives:

$p_1''(x)=6a_1x+2b_1\Rightarrow p_1''(1)=6a_1+2b_1$

$p_2''(x)=6a_2(x-1)+2b_2 \Rightarrow p_2''(1)=2b_2$

The equations are therefore:

\begin{align*}
3a_1+2b_1+c_1 &= c_2\\
6a_1+2b_1 &= 2b_2
\end{align*}
